intro: Pycnoneurum, commonly known as the mountain pines, is a genus of coniferous evergreen trees belonging to the family Pinaceae. These plants are characterized by their needle-like leaves and cone-bearing structures, which are typical of conifers. They are native to the mountainous regions of Asia, particularly in the Himalayas and eastern China. Pycnoneurum species typically grow in high-altitude environments, where they adapt to cold and harsh climatic conditions. Their ecological role includes providing habitat for various alpine species and contributing to soil stabilization in rocky terrains.
